sentence.Network_en: He had a reputation for being bloody-minded and difficult.
sentence.Network_cn: 他为人刻薄、难相处是出了名的。

sentence.Network_en: He is loathed by some of the more traditionally minded officers.
sentence.Network_cn: 他为某些思想较守旧的官员所憎恶。

sentence.Network_en: He was criticised for being boring, strait-laced and narrow-minded.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被指无趣乏味，古板守旧，心胸狭窄。

你的心智(mind)会对其他人的形相有好恶之别，不仅是他们的身体，也包括他们的心智。
关于正念(Mindfulness)，对那些修净土的人而言，禅学会的耕耘先生是这么说的： “所谓正念，就是无私无我，正大光明的想念……各 …

entry.def: If someone is minded to do something, they want or intend to do it.

example.ex: The Home Office said at that time that it was minded to reject his application for political asylum...
example.tran: 那时候内政部称其准备驳回他的政治避难申请。

example.ex: If the Americans were so minded then they could take sanctions against them.
example.tran: 要是美国人非要这么做的话，那么他们可以对其进行制裁。

means.word_mean: 1. (used in combination) mentally oriented toward something specified;
2. (used in combination) being of a specified kind of inclination or disposition;

sentences.sentence: "he is apt to ignore matters he considers unimportant"
"I am not minded to answer any questions"
